originalText.text: Love him.  Kind, friendly, compassionate about his patients.  When I couldn’t get an emergency appointment with a neurologist, he got me an appointment with a renowned neurologist that specializes in my rare autoimmune disease.  Without Dr. Saltzman’s efforts I was going to have to wait months to even see my neurologist.

originalText.text: Great experience! Friendly and welcoming staff and Dr. Saltzman’s bedside manner was excellent – really takes the time to do a thorough evaluation of all issues.

text.text: Great experience! Friendly and welcoming staff and Dr. Saltzman’s bedside manner was excellent – really takes the time to do a thorough evaluation of all issues.

originalText.text: I have been fortunate enough to cross professional paths with Dr. Saltzman on two occassions. The first involved my adult daughter, just returning from her wedding in Mexico. She was extremely ill and went to an ER upon return.  The doctor there refused to test her blood, misdiagnosed her condition and sent her home.  The next day, thanks to a friend, she saw Dr. Saltzman.  He immediately hospitalized her and started treating her for a bacterial infection. which turned out to be infectious colitis. She was in the hospital for 5 days.  Over a year ago, I sensed there was something going on physically that was problematic.  I was suffering with extreme fatigue and a fogginess that I couldn't explain.  My internist did tests, found nothing and then told me perhaps I was depressed and needed to talk to someone. I knew it was more. My blood work started changing  and after seeing a series of specialists, I was getting frustrated. Over a years since I complained of the severe fatigue.  I went to Dr. Saltzman for another problem, a bacterial UTI that would not go away.  He looked at my blood work and told me he was going to treat me for Lymes disease. Within days of taking the meds the fog started to lift and my UTI seemed to be getting better.  He listened to me and that made a big difference. I'd been sent to so many other doctors and the communication between my PCP and them and me was fair at best. I feel like I'm finally on the mend. Thank you Dr. Saltzman for looking at this as a challenge.

originalText.text: Dr Saltzman is an exceptionally talented internist and infectious disease specialist with unusually broad and deep knowledge. He helped lead the fight in the early days of the HIV/AIDS crisis in NYC. He acts as my HIV doc and also as my internist dealing with regular checkups, any kind of common infection or unusual (e.g., tic borne) disease. He even draws blood himself. When you go to see him, you see an experienced doctor who spends whatever time you need. You are not shunted off to a nurse practitioner or office assistant (no disrespect intended to those professionals); raster, you get unrushed face time with an experienced physician who is on the cutting edge in terms of knowledge, but an old fashioned (in the best sense of that word) professional doctor who cares. Dr. Saltzman is kind, careful, caring, thoughtful, funny and sophisticated. His office is extremely well run — Carol at the front desk handle everything smoothly and professionally, and has gone out of her way to help me with insurance company bureaucracy. I highly recommend Dr. Saltzman to anyone —especially those on the UES, where his office is located — looking for a GP, HIV specialist or infectious disease specialist. 5 plus stars!
